column2: Eaton Vance Municipal Bond Fund is a non-diversified, closed-end management investment company. The Fund's investment objective is to provide current income exempt from regular federal income tax, including alternative minimum tax, and, in state specific funds, taxes in its specified state. The Fund invests primarily in debt securities issued by municipalities. The Fund may invest in residual interest bonds, also referred to as inverse floating rate securities, whereby it may sell a variable or fixed rate bond for cash to a Special-Purpose Vehicle (the SPV), while at the same time, buying a residual interest in the assets and cash flows of the SPV. The Fund's investment portfolio includes various sectors, such as special tax, healthcare-acute, education, insured escrowed, and water and sewer. Eaton Vance Management is the investment advisor for the Fund.
